section.title: Reviewing the changes in the files before a commit
section.section:
See the differences in the working tree since the last commit
LARSPRIMARYINDEX"git diff"LARSPRIMARYINDEX
LARSPRIMARYINDEX"unstaged changes"LARSPRIMARYINDEX
LARSPRIMARYINDEX"git diff"LARSPRIMARYINDEX LARSSECONDARY"unstaged changes"LARSSECONDARY
The git diff command allows seeing the changes in the working tree compared to the last commit.

section.title: Example: Using "git diff" to see the file changes in the working tree
section.para: In order to test this, make some changes to a file and check what the git diff command shows to you. Afterwards commit the changes to the repository.

section.section:
See differences between staging area and last commit
LARSPRIMARYINDEX"git diff"LARSPRIMARYINDEX LARSSECONDARY"between staging area and commit"LARSSECONDARY
To see which changes you have staged, i.e., you are going to commit with the next commit, use the following command.
